snippet: If a catastrophic cyberattack occurs in the United States, Americans will be justified in asking why their lawmakers failed to protect them.
abstract: Editorial criticizes Congress for failing to pass a strong bill that would help the nation ward off cyberattacks; urges the Senate to vote on a pending bill that would require companies to establish mandatory minimum standards for computer security.
lead_paragraph: If a catastrophic cyberattack occurs in the United States, Americans will be justified in asking why their lawmakers failed to protect them.
